House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to provide authority for the President to stabilize prices, wages, interest rates, and corporate dividends.

summary.text: Economic Stabilization Act of 1985 - Authorizes the President, through FY 1989, to issue such orders and regulations as may be deemed appropriate to stabilize prices, rents, wages, salaries, and profits at levels not less than those prevailing on January 1, 1985, and to stabilize interest rates and corporate dividends and similar transfers at levels consistent with orderly economic growth. Establishes a $25,000 maximum fine for, and provides for injunctive relief from, violations of any such orders.

titles.title: A bill to provide authority for the President to stabilize prices, wages, interest rates, and corporate dividends.
